FUNCTION has357(n) RESULT(res)
  INTEGER, INTENT(IN) :: n
  LOGICAL :: res
  CHARACTER(LEN=20) :: s
  WRITE(s, '(I0)') n
  s = ADJUSTL(s)  ! Remove leading spaces
  res = (INDEX(s, '3') > 0) .AND. (INDEX(s, '5') > 0) .AND. (INDEX(s, '7') > 0)
END FUNCTION has357

Next, the next_i subroutine:

SUBROUTINE next_i(current, next)
  INTEGER, INTENT(IN) :: current
  INTEGER, INTENT(OUT) :: next
  CHARACTER(LEN=20) :: s, temp_str, reversed_str
  INTEGER :: len, i, a_char
  LOGICAL :: f

  WRITE(s, '(I0)') current
  len = LEN_TRIM(s)
  f = .FALSE. temp_str = ''

  DO i = 1, len
     a_char = s(LEN_TRIM(s) - i + 1: LEN_TRIM(s) - i + 1) IF (.NOT. f) THEN
        SELECT CASE (a_char)
        CASE ('3')
           temp_str = TRIM(temp_str) // '5'
           f = .TRUE.
        CASE ('5')
           temp_str = TRIM(temp_str) // '7'
           f = .TRUE. CASE DEFAULT
           temp_str = TRIM(temp_str) // '3'
        END SELECT
     ELSE
        temp_str = TRIM(temp_str) // a_char
     END IF
  END DO

  IF (.NOT. f) THEN
     temp_str = TRIM(temp_str) // '3'
  END IF

  ! Reverse temp_str to get the next number
  reversed_str = ''
  DO i = LEN_TRIM(temp_str), 1, -1
     reversed_str = TRIM(reversed_str) // temp_str(i:i)
  END DO

  READ(reversed_str, *) next
END SUBROUTINE next_i

PROGRAM main
  IMPLICIT NONE
  INTEGER :: N, c, bills, i, new_i
  INTEGER, PARAMETER :: max_digits = 20
  INTEGER :: digits(max_digits +1)
  CHARACTER(LEN=20) :: number_str
  LOGICAL :: has357
  INTEGER :: len

  ! Read N
  READ(*,*) N

  ! Compute c
  c = 0
  i = 357
  DO
     IF (i > N) EXIT IF (has357(i)) THEN
        c = c +1
     END IF
     CALL next_i(i, new_i)
     i = new_i
  END DO

  ! Compute bills from c
  WRITE(number_str, '(I0)') c
  len = LEN_TRIM(number_str)
  digits = 0
  DO i = 1, len
     digits(i) = ICHAR(number_str(len -i +1: len -i +1)) - ICHAR('0')
  END DO
  digits(len+1) = 0

  bills = 0
  DO i = 1, len +1
     IF (digits(i) == 10) THEN
        digits(i+1) = digits(i+1) +1
        digits(i) = 0
     END IF
     IF (digits(i) <5) THEN
        bills = bills + digits(i)
     ELSE IF (digits(i) ==5) THEN
        IF (digits(i+1) >=5) THEN
           digits(i+1) = digits(i+1) +1
        END IF
        bills = bills +5
     ELSE
        digits(i+1) = digits(i+1) +1
        bills = bills + (10 - digits(i))
     END IF
  END DO

FUNCTION has357(n) RESULT(res)
  INTEGER, INTENT(IN) :: n
  LOGICAL :: res
  CHARACTER(LEN=20) :: s
  WRITE(s, '(I0)') n
  s = ADJUSTL(s)  ! Remove leading spaces
  res = (INDEX(s, '3') > 0) .AND. (INDEX(s, '5') > 0) .AND. (INDEX(s, '7') > 0)
END FUNCTION has357

Next, the next_i subroutine:

SUBROUTINE next_i(current, next)
  INTEGER, INTENT(IN) :: current
  INTEGER, INTENT(OUT) :: next
  CHARACTER(LEN=20) :: s, temp_str, reversed_str
  INTEGER :: len, i, a_char
  LOGICAL :: f

  WRITE(s, '(I0)') current
  len = LEN_TRIM(s)
  f = .FALSE.
  temp_str = ''

  DO i = 1, len
     a_char = s(LEN_TRIM(s) - i + 1: LEN_TRIM(s) - i + 1)
     IF (.NOT. f) THEN
        SELECT CASE (a_char)
        CASE ('3')
           temp_str = TRIM(temp_str) // '5'
           f = .TRUE.
        CASE ('5')
           temp_str = TRIM(temp_str) // '7'
           f = .TRUE.
        CASE DEFAULT
           temp_str = TRIM(temp_str) // '3'
        END SELECT
     ELSE
        temp_str = TRIM(temp_str) // a_char
     END IF
  END DO

  IF (.NOT. f) THEN
     temp_str = TRIM(temp_str) // '3'
  END IF

  ! Reverse temp_str to get the next number
  reversed_str = ''
  DO i = LEN_TRIM(temp_str), 1, -1
     reversed_str = TRIM(reversed_str) // temp_str(i:i)
  END DO

  READ(reversed_str, *) next
END SUBROUTINE next_i

PROGRAM main
  IMPLICIT NONE
  INTEGER :: N, c, bills, i, new_i
  INTEGER, PARAMETER :: max_digits = 20
  INTEGER :: digits(max_digits +1)
  CHARACTER(LEN=20) :: number_str
  LOGICAL :: has357
  INTEGER :: len

  ! Read N
  READ(*,*) N

  ! Compute c
  c = 0
  i = 357

        c = c +1
     END IF

     i = new_i
  END DO

  len = LEN_TRIM(number_str)
  digits = 0
  DO i = 1, len

  bills = 0
